ground_truth: Jean rushes toward the door, cloaked by the shower curtain but awkwardly trying to push it off; still thrashing, Jean crashes against the upstairs railing, trips on the curtain and falls, thumping crazily down the stairs. Grimsrud follows and trots down after her. Wade sits behind his desk; another man rises as Jerry enters, and Stan Grossman shakes his hand. Wade scowls, looks at Stan, and is angry. We are high and wide on the office building's parking lot. Jerry emerges wrapped in a parka, his arms sticking stiffly out at his sides, his breath vaporizing. He goes to his car, opens its front door, pulls out a red plastic scraper and starts methodically scraping off the thin crust of ice that has developed on his windshield; the scrape-scrape-scrape sound carries in the frigid air. Jerry goes into a frenzy, banging the scraper against the windshield and the hood of his car, but the tantrum passes; scrape-scrape-scrape - he goes back to work on the windshield. The door swings open and Jerry edges in, looking about, holding a sack of groceries. He shuts the door and has already seen the shower curtain on the floor. Jerry stands in wide shot, hands on hips, looking down at a telephone; after a motionless beat he picks up the phone and punches in a number. It is a flannel-shirt woodsman carrying a double-edged axe over one shoulder. As we hear the rumble of an approaching car, the continuing tilt and boom down brings us down the woodsman's body to a pedestal. A sweep of headlights illuminates a sign on the pedestal. The headlights sweep off and a car hums past and on into the background. The two-lane highway is otherwise empty. Carl drives while Jean lies bound and curled on the back seat underneath a tarpaulin, and from the back seat we hear whimpering. Grimsrud smokes and gazes out the window, then turns to look and stares at Carl, then turns back to the window. At a loud WHOOP Carl starts and looks back out the rear window; fifty yards behind a state trooper has turned on his gumballs. Carl looks up at the rear-view mirror and Grimsrud looks at him. Both cars have stopped, and Carl looks into the back seat as the car bounces and slows on the gravel shoulder. The trooper is stopped on the shoulder just behind them, writing in his citation book, as Carl watches and Grimsrud stares at Carl. The trooper walks up the shoulder, one hand resting lightly on top of his holster, his breath steaming in the cold night air. Carl opens his window as the trooper draws up; the trooper scans car interior, taking his time, while Grimsrud smokes and gazes calmly out his window.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Jean dashes toward the entrance, shrouded by the shower drape but clumsily attempting to shove it off; still flailing, Jean collides against the upstairs banister, stumbles on the drape and plummets, thudding wildly down the steps. Grimsrud trails and jogs down after her. Wade perches behind his counter; another gentleman ascends as Jerry arrives, and Stan Grossman grasps his hand. Wade frowns, glances at Stan, and is irate. We are elevated and expansive on the office edifice's parking area. Jerry appears wrapped in a parka, his limbs jutting stiffly out at his sides, his breath condensing. He proceeds to his vehicle, unlatches its front door, pulls out a crimson plastic scraper and begins systematically scraping off the slender crust of frost that has formed on his windscreen; the scrape-scrape-scrape noise echoes in the icy air. Jerry descends into a frenzy, striking the scraper against the windscreen and the hood of his vehicle, but the tantrum subsides; scrape-scrape-scrape - he returns to labor on the windscreen. The entrance swings open and Jerry edges in, scanning around, clutching a sack of provisions. He closes the entrance and has already spotted the shower drape on the ground. Jerry stands in broad shot, hands on hips, gazing down at a telephone; after a still beat he lifts the receiver and dials a numeral. It is a flannel-shirt woodsman bearing a dual-edged axe over one shoulder. As we hear the rumble of an approaching automobile, the continuing tilt and boom down brings us down the woodsman's form to a base. A sweep of headlights illuminates a sign on the base. The headlights sweep off and an automobile hums by and on into the distance. The two-lane roadway is otherwise barren. Carl maneuvers while Jean reclines bound and curled on the rear seat beneath a tarpaulin, and from the rear seat we hear whimpering. Grimsrud puffs and gazes out the pane, then rotates to look and stares at Carl, then rotates back to the pane. At a loud WHOOP Carl starts and peers back out the rear pane; fifty yards behind a state officer has activated his gumballs. Carl glances up at the rear-view mirror and Grimsrud glances at him. Both vehicles have halted, and Carl gazes into the rear seat as the automobile bounces and decelerates on the gravel shoulder. The officer is halted on the shoulder just behind them, scribbling in his citation book, as Carl observes and Grimsrud stares at Carl. The officer strides up the shoulder, one hand resting lightly on top of his holster, his breath misting in the frigid night air. Carl lowers his pane as the officer draws up; the officer scans the vehicle's interior, taking his time, while Grimsrud puffs and gazes serenely out his pane.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Jean is rushed toward the door, cloaked by the shower curtain but awkwardly trying to push it off; still thrashing, the upstairs railing is crashed against by Jean, the curtain is tripped on by her, and she is caused to fall, thumping crazily down the stairs. Grimsrud follows and trots down after her. Wade sits behind his desk; another man is risen as Jerry enters, and Stan Grossman is shaken hands with by him. Wade scowls, looks at Stan, and is made angry. We high and wide on the office building's parking lot show. Jerry is emerged wrapped in a parka, his arms stiffly stuck out at his sides, his breath vaporizing. His car is gone to by him, its front door is opened, a red plastic scraper is pulled out by him and the thin crust of ice that has developed on his windshield is methodically started to be scraped off; the scrape-scrape-scrape sound is carried in the frigid air. A frenzy is gone into by Jerry, the scraper is banged by him against the windshield and the hood of his car, but the tantrum passes; scrape-scrape-scrape - the work on the windshield is gone back to by him. The door is swung open and Jerry is edged in, looking about, a sack of groceries is held by him. The door is shut by him and the shower curtain on the floor has already been seen by him. Jerry is stood in wide shot, hands on hips, looking down at a telephone; after a motionless beat, the phone is picked up by him and he punches in a number. It is a flannel-shirt woodsman carrying a double-edged axe over one shoulder. As the rumble of an approaching car is heard by us, the continuing tilt and boom down bring us down the woodsman's body to a pedestal. A sweep of headlights illuminates a sign on the pedestal. The headlights sweep off and a car is hummed past and on into the background by it. The two-lane highway is otherwise empty. Carl drives while Jean is bound and curled on the back seat underneath a tarpaulin, and whimpering is heard by us from the back seat. Grimsrud smokes and gazes out the window, then he turns, looks, and stares at Carl, then turns back to the window. At a loud WHOOP Carl is started and the rear window is looked back out by him; fifty yards behind a state trooper has turned on his gumballs. The rear-view mirror is looked up at by Carl and Grimsrud looks at him. Both cars are stopped, and the back seat is looked into by Carl as the car is bounced and slowed on the gravel shoulder. The trooper is stopped on the shoulder just behind them, writing in his citation book, as Carl watches and Grimsrud stares at Carl. The trooper walks up the shoulder, one hand is resting lightly on top of his holster by him, his breath steaming in the cold night air. The window is opened by Carl as the trooper draws up; the car interior is scanned by the trooper, he takes his time, while Grimsrud smokes and gazes calmly out his window.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Jean rushes to the door, awkwardly tangled in the shower curtain, crashes against the railing, trips, and tumbles down the stairs. Grimsrud follows her. Wade sits at his desk; another man stands as Jerry enters, and Stan Grossman shakes his hand. Wade scowls at Stan, clearly angry. Outside, Jerry, in a parka, breath visible, scrapes ice off his car windshield. He bangs the scraper in frustration but resumes scraping. Jerry enters with groceries, notices the shower curtain on the floor, and stands with hands on hips before dialing a number. A woodsman with an axe is illuminated by car headlights on a two-lane highway. Carl drives with Jean bound under a tarpaulin in the back seat, whimpering. Grimsrud smokes, staring out the window, then at Carl. A state trooper's siren startles Carl; both cars stop. The trooper writes a citation as Carl watches and Grimsrud smokes. The trooper approaches, scanning the car interior, while Grimsrud gazes out the window.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Jean rushes to the door, tangled in the shower curtain, crashes against the railing, trips, and tumbles down the stairs. Grimsrud follows her. Wade sits at his desk; another man stands as Jerry enters, and Stan Grossman shakes his hand. Wade scowls at Stan, angry. Outside the office building, Jerry, in a parka, scrapes ice off his car windshield. He bangs the scraper in frustration but resumes scraping. Jerry enters, holding groceries, sees the shower curtain on the floor, and picks up the phone. A flannel-shirted woodsman with an axe is illuminated by car headlights. Carl drives with Jean bound under a tarpaulin in the back seat, whimpering. Grimsrud smokes, gazes out, then stares at Carl. A state trooper turns on his lights behind them. Carl and Grimsrud exchange looks as both cars stop. The trooper approaches, hand on his holster, breath steaming. Carl opens his window as the trooper scans the car interior, while Grimsrud smokes calmly.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Jean, in a frantic rush, makes her way toward the door, awkwardly cloaked by the shower curtain that she is desperately trying to push off. Still thrashing about, she crashes against the upstairs railing, trips over the curtain, and tumbles, thumping wildly and uncontrollably down the stairs. Grimsrud, observing the commotion, follows her and trots down the stairs after her. Meanwhile, Wade is seated behind his desk; as Jerry enters the room, another man stands up, and Stan Grossman extends his hand for a handshake. Wade, with a scowl on his face, looks at Stan, clearly displaying his anger. We find ourselves high and wide, overlooking the parking lot of the office building. Jerry emerges, wrapped snugly in a parka, his arms sticking stiffly out at his sides, with his breath visibly vaporizing in the cold air. He makes his way to his car, opens the front door, and retrieves a red plastic scraper. He then begins methodically scraping off the thin crust of ice that has formed on his windshield; the repetitive scrape-scrape-scrape sound echoes in the frigid air. Suddenly, Jerry goes into a frenzy, banging the scraper against the windshield and the hood of his car, but the tantrum soon passes; scrape-scrape-scrape - he resumes his work on the windshield. The door swings open, and Jerry edges inside, looking around cautiously, holding a sack of groceries. He shuts the door and immediately notices the shower curtain lying on the floor. Jerry stands in a wide shot, hands on his hips, looking down at a telephone; after a moment of stillness, he picks up the phone and punches in a number. We see a flannel-shirted woodsman carrying a double-edged axe over one shoulder. As the rumble of an approaching car is heard, the continuing tilt and boom down brings us down the woodsman's body to a pedestal. A sweep of headlights illuminates a sign on the pedestal. The headlights sweep off, and a car hums past, continuing on into the background. The two-lane highway is otherwise empty and desolate. Carl is driving while Jean lies bound and curled up on the back seat underneath a tarpaulin, and from the back seat, we hear her whimpering. Grimsrud, smoking, gazes out the window, then turns to look and stares intently at Carl, before turning back to the window. At a loud WHOOP, Carl starts and looks back out the rear window; fifty yards behind, a state trooper has turned on his gumballs. Carl glances up at the rear-view mirror, and Grimsrud looks at him. Both cars have come to a stop, and Carl looks into the back seat as the car bounces and slows on the gravel shoulder. The trooper is stopped on the shoulder just behind them, writing in his citation book, as Carl watches and Grimsrud continues to stare at Carl. The trooper walks up the shoulder, one hand resting lightly on top of his holster, his breath steaming in the cold night air. Carl opens his window as the trooper approaches; the trooper scans the car's interior, taking his time, while Grimsrud smokes and gazes calmly out his window.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Jean, in an almost frantic and panicked rush, makes her way toward the door, awkwardly and clumsily cloaked by the cumbersome shower curtain that she is desperately and unsuccessfully trying to push away and off herself. Still thrashing about in a state of disarray, she unintentionally crashes against the upstairs railing, trips over the cumbersome curtain, and subsequently tumbles, thumping wildly and uncontrollably down the staircase. Grimsrud, observing this chaotic commotion from nearby, quickly follows her trajectory and trots down the stairs after her. Meanwhile, Wade is seated comfortably behind his desk; as Jerry enters the room, another man immediately stands up, and Stan Grossman promptly extends his hand for a cordial handshake. Wade, with a deep scowl etched on his face, looks at Stan, clearly and unmistakably displaying his anger and displeasure. We find ourselves positioned high and wide, overlooking the expansive parking lot of the office building. Jerry emerges into the scene, wrapped snugly and warmly in a substantial parka, his arms sticking stiffly out at his sides, with each breath visibly vaporizing in the frigid and biting cold air. He then makes his way over to his car, opens the front door, and retrieves a red plastic scraper. With determination, he begins methodically scraping off the thin crust of ice that has formed on his windshield; the repetitive and consistent scrape-scrape-scrape sound echoes sharply in the cold, still air. Suddenly, Jerry goes into a wild frenzy, angrily banging the scraper against the windshield and the hood of his car, but this brief tantrum soon passes; scrape-scrape-scrape - he resumes his diligent work on the windshield. The door swings open with a soft creak, and Jerry edges cautiously inside, looking around carefully, holding a sack of groceries. He shuts the door behind him and immediately notices the shower curtain lying conspicuously on the floor. Jerry stands in a wide shot, hands planted firmly on his hips, looking down at a telephone; after a brief moment of stillness and contemplation, he finally picks up the phone and punches in a number. We see a flannel-shirted woodsman carrying a large double-edged axe over one shoulder. As the rumble of an approaching car grows louder, the continuing tilt and boom down brings our view down the woodsman's body to a pedestal he stands on. A sweeping arc of headlights suddenly illuminates a sign on the pedestal. The headlights sweep off just as quickly, and the car hums past, continuing its journey into the distant background. The two-lane highway remains otherwise empty and desolate. Carl is behind the wheel driving while Jean lies bound and curled up on the back seat underneath a heavy tarpaulin, and from the confines of the back seat, we hear her soft whimpering. Grimsrud, casually smoking, gazes out the window thoughtfully, then turns to look and stares intently at Carl for a moment before turning back to gaze out the window again. At the sudden sound of a loud WHOOP, Carl starts with a jolt and looks back out the rear window; fifty yards behind, a state trooper has turned on his gumballs, signaling a stop. Carl glances up anxiously at the rear-view mirror, and Grimsrud looks at him pointedly. Both cars have slowly come to a stop, and Carl looks into the back seat as the car bounces and slows on the gravel shoulder. The trooper has stopped on the shoulder just behind them, writing diligently in his citation book, as Carl watches and Grimsrud continues to stare steadfastly at Carl. The trooper walks up the shoulder with measured steps, one hand resting lightly on the top of his holster, his breath visibly steaming in the frigid cold night air. Carl opens his window with a deliberate motion as the trooper approaches; the trooper scans the car's interior cautiously, taking his time, while Grimsrud smokes leisurely and gazes calmly out his window.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Jean, in a frantic rush, makes her way toward the door, her movements hindered by the shower curtain that clings to her, creating an awkward struggle as she attempts to push it off. In her thrashing, she collides with the upstairs railing, loses her balance due to the entangling curtain, and tumbles, her body thumping wildly as she descends the stairs. Grimsrud, observing the chaos, follows her and makes his way down the stairs at a steady pace. Meanwhile, Wade is seated behind his desk, and as Jerry enters the room, another man stands up. This man, Stan Grossman, extends his hand to Jerry for a handshake. Wade, however, scowls, casting an angry glance at Stan. The scene shifts to a high and wide view of the office building's parking lot, where Jerry emerges, bundled in a parka with his arms protruding stiffly at his sides, his breath visible in the cold air. He approaches his car, opens the front door, retrieves a red plastic scraper, and begins the methodical task of scraping the thin layer of ice from his windshield, the repetitive scrape-scrape-scrape sound echoing in the frigid atmosphere. Suddenly, Jerry is overcome with frustration, and he erupts into a frenzy, violently banging the scraper against the windshield and the hood of his car. The tantrum subsides, and he resumes his task, scrape-scrape-scrape, continuing to clear the windshield. Later, Jerry carefully edges into a room, holding a sack of groceries, and as he shuts the door, he notices the shower curtain lying on the floor. Standing in a wide shot, with his hands on his hips, he gazes down at a telephone. After a moment of stillness, he picks up the phone and dials a number. In another scene, a flannel-shirted woodsman carries a double-edged axe over one shoulder. As the rumble of an approaching car grows louder, the camera tilts and booms down the woodsman's body to reveal a pedestal. Headlights sweep across, illuminating a sign on the pedestal before the car hums past and continues into the background, leaving the otherwise empty two-lane highway behind. Inside the car, Carl drives while Jean lies bound and curled on the back seat beneath a tarpaulin, her whimpering audible from the back. Grimsrud, smoking, gazes out the window, then turns to stare at Carl before returning his gaze to the window. A sudden loud WHOOP startles Carl, prompting him to look back out the rear window, where he sees a state trooper fifty yards behind, having turned on his gumballs. Carl glances up at the rear-view mirror, and Grimsrud looks at him. Both cars come to a stop, and as Carl's car bounces and slows on the gravel shoulder, he looks into the back seat. The trooper, having stopped on the shoulder just behind them, writes in his citation book while Carl watches and Grimsrud continues to stare at Carl. The trooper approaches, walking up the shoulder with one hand resting lightly on top of his holster, his breath visible in the cold night air. Carl rolls down his window as the trooper arrives, taking his time to scan the car's interior, while Grimsrud smokes and gazes calmly out his window.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Jean, entangled in a shower curtain, rushes toward the door, crashes against the upstairs railing, and tumbles down the stairs. Grimsrud follows her descent. Meanwhile, in an office, Wade sits behind his desk, scowling as Jerry enters and shakes hands with Stan Grossman. Outside, Jerry, bundled in a parka, methodically scrapes ice off his car windshield, briefly succumbing to a tantrum before resuming his task. Later, Jerry enters a room with groceries, notices the shower curtain on the floor, and, after a pause, dials a number on the phone. In a different scene, a woodsman with an axe is illuminated by passing car headlights on an otherwise empty highway. Carl drives with Jean bound under a tarpaulin in the back seat, while Grimsrud smokes and gazes out the window. A state trooper activates his lights behind them, prompting Carl to check the rear-view mirror. Both cars stop, and the trooper approaches, scanning the car's interior as Grimsrud continues to smoke and look out the window.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description:
Jean rushes toward the door, cloaked by the shower curtain but awkwardly trying to push it off; still thrashing, Jean crashes against the upstairs railing of the two-story suburban home, trips on the curtain and falls, thumping crazily down the stairs with a chaotic clatter. Grimsrud, a stoic and intimidating figure known for his criminal background, follows and trots down after her. 

Wade sits behind his desk in an office decorated with family photos and awards; another man rises as Jerry enters, and Stan Grossman, a prominent businessman known for his keen negotiation skills, shakes his hand. Wade scowls, looks at Stan, and is angry. We are high and wide on the office building's parking lot, which is notably spacious and lined with rows of well-maintained vehicles. Jerry emerges wrapped in a parka, his arms sticking stiffly out at his sides, his breath vaporizing in the frigid temperatures common to Minnesota winters. He goes to his car, opens its front door, pulls out a red plastic scraper, essential for dealing with icy conditions, and starts methodically scraping off the thin crust of ice that has developed on his windshield; the scrape-scrape-scrape sound carries in the frigid air, resonating in the stillness. Jerry goes into a frenzy, banging the scraper against the windshield and the hood of his car, but the tantrum passes; scrape-scrape-scrape - he goes back to work on the windshield. 

The door swings open to a cold burst of air and Jerry edges in, looking about, holding a sack of groceries from the local market. He shuts the door and has already seen the shower curtain on the floor, a remnant of the earlier chaos. Jerry stands in wide shot, hands on hips, looking down at a telephone; after a motionless beat he picks up the phone and punches in a number. It is a flannel-shirt woodsman, a rugged individual used to the harsh outdoor elements, carrying a double-edged axe over one shoulder. As we hear the rumble of an approaching car, the continuing tilt and boom down brings us down the woodsman's body to a pedestal, a makeshift signpost indicating a nearby trailhead. A sweep of headlights illuminates a sign on the pedestal. The headlights sweep off and a car hums past and on into the background. The two-lane highway is otherwise empty, a desolate stretch often subjected to treacherous weather conditions. 

Carl drives along this lonely highway while Jean lies bound and curled on the back seat underneath a tarpaulin, muffling her sounds, and from the back seat we hear whimpering. Grimsrud smokes a cigarette with an air of detachment and gazes out the window, then turns to look and stares at Carl, then turns back to the window. At a loud WHOOP Carl starts and looks back out the rear window; fifty yards behind, a state trooper has turned on his gumballs, a colloquial term for police lights. Carl looks up at the rear-view mirror and Grimsrud looks at him. Both cars have stopped, and Carl looks into the back seat as the car bounces and slows on the gravel shoulder. The trooper is stopped on the shoulder just behind them, writing in his citation book, as Carl watches and Grimsrud stares at Carl. The trooper walks up the shoulder, one hand resting lightly on top of his holster, a standard safety procedure, his breath steaming in the cold night air. Carl opens his window as the trooper draws up; the trooper scans the car interior, taking his time and ensuring caution in his approach, while Grimsrud smokes and gazes calmly out his window.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. As we hear the rumble of an approaching car the continuing tilt and boom down brings us down the woodsman's body to a pedestal. A sweep of headlights illuminates a sign on the pedestal. The headlights sweep off and a car hums past and on into the background. The twolane highway is otherwise empty. Carl drives while Jean lies bound and curled on the back seat underneath a tarpaulin and from the back seat we hear whimpering. Grimsrud smokes and gazes out the window then turns to look and stares at. Carl then turns back to the window. At a loud WHOOP. Carl starts and looks back out the rear window fifty yards behind. a state trooper has turned on his gumballs. Carl looks up at the rearview mirror and Grimsrud looks at him. Both cars have stopped and Carl looks into the back seat as the car bounces and slows on the gravel shoulder. The trooper is stopped on the shoulder just behind them writing in his citation book as Carl watches and Grimsrud stares at Carl. The trooper walks up the shoulder one hand resting lightly on top of his holster his breath steaming in the cold night air. Carl opens his window as the trooper draws up. the trooper scans car interior taking his time while Grimsrud smokes and gazes calmly out his window.

test_cases.description: Jean rushes toward the door cloaked by the shower curtain but awkwardly trying to push it off. still thrashing. Jean crashes against the upstairs railing trips on the curtain and falls thumping crazily down the stairs. Grimsrud follows and trots down after her. Wade sits behind his desk. another man rises as Jerry enters and Stan Grossman shakes his hand. Wade scowls looks at Stan and is angry. We are high and wide on the office building's parking lot. Jerry emerges wrapped in a parka his arms sticking stiffly out at his sides his breath vaporizing. He goes to his car opens its front door pulls out a red plastic scraper and starts methodically scraping off the thin crust of ice that has developed on his windshield. the scrapescrapescrape sound carries in the frigid air. Jerry goes into a frenzy banging the scraper against the windshield and the hood of his car but the tantrum passes scrapescrapescrape. he goes back to work on the windshield. The door swings open and Jerry edges in looking about holding a sack of groceries. He shuts the door and has already seen the shower curtain on the floor. Jerry stands in wide shot hands on hips looking down at a telephone after a motionless beat. he picks up the phone and punches in a number. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Jean rushes toward the door cloaked by the shower curtain but awkwardly trying to push it off. still thrashing. Jean crashes against the upstairs railing trips on the curtain and falls thumping crazily down the stairs. Grimsrud follows and trots down after her. The trooper walks up the shoulder one hand resting lightly on top of his holster his breath steaming in the cold night air. Carl opens his window as the trooper draws up. the trooper scans car interior taking his time while Grimsrud smokes and gazes calmly out his window.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The rabbit rushes toward the door, cloaked by the shower curtain but awkwardly trying to push it off; still thrashing, the rabbit crashes against the upstairs railing, trips on the curtain and falls, thumping crazily down the stairs. The turtle follows and trots down after the rabbit. The fox sits behind his desk; another man rises as the squirrel enters, and the penguin shakes his hand. The fox scowls, looks at the penguin, and is angry. We are high and wide on the office building's parking lot. The squirrel emerges wrapped in a parka, his arms sticking stiffly out at his sides, his breath vaporizing. The squirrel goes to his car, opens its front door, pulls out a red plastic scraper and starts methodically scraping off the thin crust of ice that has developed on his windshield; the scrape-scrape-scrape sound carries in the frigid air. The squirrel goes into a frenzy, banging the scraper against the windshield and the hood of his car, but the tantrum passes; scrape-scrape-scrape - the squirrel goes back to work on the windshield. The door swings open and the squirrel edges in, looking about, holding a sack of groceries. The squirrel shuts the door and has already seen the shower curtain on the floor. The squirrel stands in wide shot, hands on hips, looking down at a telephone; after a motionless beat the squirrel picks up the phone and punches in a number. It is a flannel-shirt woodsman carrying a double-edged axe over one shoulder. As we hear the rumble of an approaching car, the continuing tilt and boom down brings us down the woodsman's body to a pedestal. A sweep of headlights illuminates a sign on the pedestal. The headlights sweep off and a car hums past and on into the background. The two-lane highway is otherwise empty. The horse drives while the rabbit lies bound and curled on the back seat underneath a tarpaulin, and from the back seat we hear whimpering. The turtle smokes and gazes out the window, then turns to look and stares at the horse, then turns back to the window. At a loud WHOOP the horse starts and looks back out the rear window; fifty yards behind a state trooper has turned on his gumballs. The horse looks up at the rear-view mirror and the turtle looks at him. Both cars have stopped, and the horse looks into the back seat as the car bounces and slows on the gravel shoulder. The trooper is stopped on the shoulder just behind them, writing in his citation book, as the horse watches and the turtle stares at the horse. The trooper walks up the shoulder, one hand resting lightly on top of his holster, his breath steaming in the cold night air. The horse opens his window as the trooper draws up; the trooper scans car interior, taking his time, while the turtle smokes and gazes calmly out his window.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Jean rushes toward the wardrobe, cloaked by the picnic blanket but awkwardly trying to push it off; still thrashing, Jean crashes against the downstairs cupboard, trips on the blanket and falls, thumping crazily down the ladder. Grimsrud follows and trots down after her. Wade sits behind his counter; another man rises as Jerry enters, and Stan Grossman shakes his hand. Wade scowls, looks at Stan, and is angry. We are high and wide on the train station's platform. Jerry emerges wrapped in a poncho, his arms sticking stiffly out at his sides, his breath vaporizing. He goes to his scooter, opens its trunk, pulls out a blue metal spatula and starts methodically scraping off the thin crust of mud that has developed on his visor; the scrape-scrape-scrape sound carries in the humid air. Jerry goes into a frenzy, banging the spatula against the visor and the handlebars of his scooter, but the tantrum passes; scrape-scrape-scrape - he goes back to work on the visor. The flap swings open and Jerry edges in, looking about, holding a basket of vegetables. He shuts the flap and has already seen the picnic blanket on the floor. Jerry stands in wide shot, hands on hips, looking down at a typewriter; after a motionless beat he picks up the receiver and punches in a number. It is a denim-jacket fisherman carrying a single-edged machete over one shoulder. As we hear the rustle of an approaching train, the continuing tilt and boom down brings us down the fisherman's body to a podium. A sweep of lanterns illuminates a sign on the podium. The lanterns sweep off and a train chugs past and on into the background. The two-track railway is otherwise empty. Carl drives while Jean lies bound and curled on the back seat underneath a sailcloth, and from the back seat we hear whimpering. Grimsrud smokes and gazes out the window, then turns to look and stares at Carl, then turns back to the window. At a loud WHISTLE Carl starts and looks back out the rear window; fifty yards behind a state ranger has turned on his flashers. Carl looks up at the rear-view mirror and Grimsrud looks at him. Both trains have stopped, and Carl looks into the back seat as the train bounces and slows on the gravel siding. The ranger is stopped on the siding just behind them, writing in his notepad, as Carl watches and Grimsrud stares at Carl. The ranger walks up the siding, one hand resting lightly on top of his flashlight, his breath steaming in the cold night air. Carl opens his window as the ranger draws up; the ranger scans train interior, taking his time, while Grimsrud smokes and gazes calmly out his window.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Jean meanders toward the door, draped by the shower curtain but awkwardly trying to tug it off; still wobbling, Jean leans against the upstairs railing, slips on the curtain and descends, bouncing erratically down the stairs. Grimsrud trails and skips down after her. Wade reclines behind his desk; another man descends as Jerry arrives, and Stan Grossman taps his hand. Wade frowns, glances at Stan, and is irritated. We are high and wide on the office building's parking lot. Jerry appears bundled in a parka, his arms protruding stiffly out at his sides, his breath swirling. He ambles to his car, opens its front door, extracts a red plastic scraper and begins methodically brushing off the thin crust of ice that has formed on his windshield; the brush-brush-brush sound resonates in the frigid air. Jerry goes into a commotion, tapping the scraper against the windshield and the hood of his car, but the outburst subsides; brush-brush-brush - he returns to work on the windshield. The door glides open and Jerry slips in, glancing around, holding a sack of groceries. He closes the door and has already detected the shower curtain on the floor. Jerry stands in wide shot, hands on hips, observing down at a telephone; after a motionless beat he lifts the phone and dials a number. It is a flannel-shirt woodsman carrying a double-edged axe over one shoulder. As we hear the murmur of an approaching car, the continuing pan and zoom down brings us down the woodsman's body to a pedestal. A sweep of headlights illuminates a sign on the pedestal. The headlights drift off and a car glides past and on into the background. The two-lane highway is otherwise deserted. Carl steers while Jean lies bound and curled on the back seat underneath a tarpaulin, and from the back seat we hear murmuring. Grimsrud smokes and peers out the window, then turns to glance and frowns at Carl, then turns back to the window. At a loud WHOOP Carl hesitates and glances back out the rear window; fifty yards behind a state trooper has flashed on his gumballs. Carl peers up at the rear-view mirror and Grimsrud gazes at him. Both cars have halted, and Carl peers into the back seat as the car jiggles and decelerates on the gravel shoulder. The trooper is halted on the shoulder just behind them, scribbling in his citation book, as Carl observes and Grimsrud peers at Carl. The trooper strolls up the shoulder, one hand resting casually on top of his holster, his breath misting in the cold night air. Carl slides open his window as the trooper saunters up; the trooper scans the car interior, taking his time, while Grimsrud smokes and peers tranquilly out his window.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Max hurries toward the mailbox, veiled by the shower cap but clumsily trying to shove it off; still flailing, Max crashes against the rooftop ladder, trips on the cap and tumbles, thudding wildly down the elevator. Lenny follows and jogs down after him. Barry sits behind his bookshelf; another woman rises as Donna enters, and Milton Crandall shakes her hand. Barry frowns, looks at Milton, and is furious. We are high and wide on the amusement park's carousel. Donna emerges wrapped in a shawl, her legs sticking rigidly out at her sides, her laugh echoing. She goes to her boat, opens its cabin door, pulls out a blue rubber hammer and starts methodically hammering off the thick crust of mud that has formed on her sails; the thump-thump-thump sound carries in the humid air. Donna goes into a frenzy, banging the hammer against the sails and the mast of her boat, but the outburst fades; thump-thump-thump - she goes back to work on the sails. The window swings open and Donna slips in, looking around, holding a bundle of towels. She shuts the window and has already noticed the shower cap on the ground. Donna stands in broad view, hands on knees, looking down at a radio; after a still moment she picks up the radio and dials in a frequency. It is a leather-jacket diver lugging a single-edged sword over one arm. As we hear the rumble of an approaching bicycle, the continuing swoop and zoom down brings us down the diver's body to a platform. A sweep of strobe lights illuminates a poster on the platform. The strobe lights sweep off and a bicycle hums past and on into the backdrop. The hiking trail is otherwise empty. Saul pedals while Max rests bound and curled on the luggage rack underneath a blanket, and from the luggage rack we hear whimpering. Lenny nibbles and gazes out the porthole, then turns to look and stares at Saul, then turns back to the porthole. At a loud WHIR Saul jumps and looks back out the rear porthole; fifty meters behind a zoo keeper has turned on his flashlights. Saul looks up at the rear-view camera and Lenny looks at him. Both bicycles have stopped, and Saul looks into the luggage rack as the bicycle bounces and slows on the dirt path. The zoo keeper is stopped on the path just behind them, writing in his sketchbook, as Saul watches and Lenny stares at Saul. The zoo keeper walks up the path, one foot resting lightly on top of his clipboard, his laugh echoing in the cool dusk air. Saul opens his porthole as the zoo keeper draws up; the zoo keeper scans bicycle basket, taking his time, while Lenny nibbles and gazes calmly out his porthole.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Monica scurries toward the bookshelf, cloaked by the shower curtain but awkwardly trying to swing it off; still twisting, Monica collides against the upstairs railing, slips on the curtain and tumbles, thudding clumsily down the stairs. Douglas pursues and plods down after her. Larry sits behind his drum kit; another woman jumps as Mark enters, and Lisa Sherman nods his hand. Larry grimaces, glances at Lisa, and is furious. We are high and wide on the office building's parking lot. Mark surfaces wrapped in a parka, his arms sticking stiffly out at his sides, his breath vaporizing. He strides to his bicycle, opens its front basket, pulls out a red plastic spatula and starts carefully scraping off the thin crust of frost that has developed on his handlebars; the scrape-scrape-scrape sound carries in the chilly air. Mark goes into a tizzy, banging the spatula against the handlebars and the fender of his bicycle, but the outburst subsides; scrape-scrape-scrape - he resumes working on the handlebars. The cabinet swings open and Mark inches in, looking about, holding a stack of magazines. He closes the cabinet and has already noticed the shower curtain on the floor. Mark stands in wide shot, hands on hips, peering down at a remote control; after a motionless beat he picks up the remote and dials a channel. It is a denim-jacket sailor carrying a surfboard over one shoulder. As we hear the whistle of a passing train, the continuing pan and zoom down bring us down the sailor's body to a pedestal. A sweep of lantern light illuminates a sign on the pedestal. The lantern light sweeps off and a train chugs past and on into the background. The two-lane track is otherwise empty. Tina pedals while Monica lies bound and curled on the back seat underneath a tarpaulin, and from the back seat, we hear whimpering. Douglas sketches and gazes out the window, then turns to look and stares at Tina, then turns back to the window. At a loud CLANG Tina jumps and looks back out the rear window; fifty yards behind a station conductor has turned on his flashlight. Tina looks up at the rear-view mirror and Douglas looks at her. Both bicycles have halted, and Tina looks into the back seat as the bicycle bounces and slows on the gravel shoulder. The conductor is stopped on the shoulder just behind them, writing in his logbook, as Tina observes and Douglas stares at Tina. The conductor marches up the shoulder, one hand resting lightly on top of his lantern, his breath steaming in the cold night air. Tina opens her window as the conductor draws up; the conductor inspects the bicycle interior, taking his time, while Douglas sketches and gazes calmly out his window.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Jean sprints toward the window, cloaked by the tablecloth but awkwardly trying to fling it off; still flailing, Jean collides with the upstairs banister, stumbles on the cloth and tumbles, bouncing wildly down the ladder. Grimsrud follows and skips down after her. Wade lounges behind his counter; another man stands as Jerry arrives, and Stan Grossman salutes him. Wade frowns, glances at Stan, and is irritated. We are high and wide on the office building's garden. Jerry emerges wrapped in a trench coat, his arms sticking rigidly out at his sides, his breath swirling. He goes to his bicycle, opens its basket, pulls out a blue rubber hammer and starts methodically hammering off the thin layer of dust that has gathered on his handlebars; the thud-thud-thud sound echoes in the chilly air. Jerry goes into a frenzy, smashing the hammer against the handlebars and the frame of his bicycle, but the tantrum subsides; thud-thud-thud - he returns to work on the handlebars. The window slides open and Jerry squeezes in, looking around, holding a sack of oranges. He shuts the window and has already spotted the tablecloth on the floor. Jerry stands in long shot, hands on hips, looking down at a radio; after a motionless pause he picks up the receiver and dials a number. It is a denim-jacket lumberjack carrying a single-edged saw over one shoulder. As we hear the growl of an approaching motorcycle, the continuing pan and zoom down brings us down the lumberjack's body to a platform. A flash of headlights illuminates a poster on the platform. The headlights flash off and a motorcycle purrs past and on into the distance. The two-lane country road is otherwise deserted. Carl pedals while Jean lies wrapped and curled on the trailer underneath a canvas, and from the trailer we hear whimpering. Grimsrud sips and gazes out the window, then turns to look and examines Carl, then turns back to the window. At a loud HONK Carl jumps and looks back out the rear window; fifty yards behind a park ranger has turned on his siren. Carl glances up at the rear-view mirror and Grimsrud glances at him. Both bicycles have stopped, and Carl looks into the trailer as the bicycle bounces and slows on the gravel path. The ranger is stopped on the path just behind them, jotting in his notebook, as Carl watches and Grimsrud examines Carl. The ranger walks up the path, one hand resting lightly on top of his flashlight, his breath puffing in the cool evening air. Carl opens his window as the ranger approaches; the ranger inspects the bicycle interior, taking his time, while Grimsrud sips and gazes calmly out his window.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Nina dashes toward the wall, cloaked by the beach towel but awkwardly trying to lift it off; still flailing, Nina bounces against the attic bookshelf, stumbles on the towel and tumbles, rolling wildly down the ladder. Fluffy follows and hops down after her. Tom reclines behind his counter; another lady rises as Bob arrives, and Lily Johnson shakes his foot. Tom frowns, glances at Lily, and is cheerful. We are far and wide on the skyscraper’s bicycle rack. Bob appears wrapped in a cape, his legs jutting crookedly out at his hips, his breath crystallizing. He jogs to his scooter, unlatches its side panel, pulls out a blue metal drill and starts methodically drilling off the thick film of snow that has settled on his helmet; the drill-drill-drill sound echoes in the chilly breeze. Bob goes into a frenzy, smashing the drill against the helmet and the roof of his scooter, but the tantrum passes; drill-drill-drill - he returns to work on the helmet. The panel swings open and Bob sneaks in, glancing around, clutching a bundle of carrots. He shuts the panel and has already spotted the beach towel on the floor. Bob stands in a full view, feet on knees, peering down at a lantern; after a silent moment he lifts the lantern and dials in a frequency. It is a leather-jacket farmer carrying a single-edged shovel over one elbow. As we hear the hum of an approaching van, the descending tilt and glide down brings us down the farmer’s form to a stool. A sweep of floodlights illuminates a notice on the stool. The floodlights sweep away and a van zooms past and on into the foreground. The one-lane alley is otherwise deserted. Mike pedals while Nina rests bound and sprawled on the back shelf underneath a quilt, and from the back shelf we hear sniffling. Fluffy sips and glances out the porthole, then turns to look and points at Mike, then swivels back to the porthole. At a loud BEEP Mike jumps and peers out the side porthole; fifty feet behind a park ranger has flashed on his sirens. Mike peers up at the side-view reflector and Fluffy observes him. Both vans have paused, and Mike peeks into the back shelf as the van jolts and halts on the dirt verge. The ranger is halted on the verge just behind them, scribbling in his notebook, as Mike watches and Fluffy observes Mike. The ranger strides up the verge, one limb resting lightly on top of his belt, his breath fogging in the icy dusk air. Mike opens his porthole as the ranger steps up; the ranger scans van interior, taking his time, while Fluffy sips and peers placidly out his porthole.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Jean, cloaked by a shower curtain, crashes against the railing and tumbles down the stairs as Grimsrud follows. Meanwhile, Jerry emerges from a tense meeting with Wade and Stan Grossman, frustrated and scraping ice off his car windshield. After a moment of losing control, he calms down and continues working on the windshield. Jerry enters his house, noticing a shower curtain on the floor, and calls someone. In another scene, Carl drives with Jean bound in the back seat under a tarp while Grimsrud smokes. A state trooper pulls them over, turning on his lights. As the trooper approaches, Carl nervously eyes the rear-view mirror while Grimsrud remains composed and looks out the window.

continuing tilt and boom down brings us down the woodsman's body to a pedestal  It is a flannelshirt woodsman carrying a doubleedged axe over one shoulder  he picks up the phone and punches in a number  Jerry stands in wide shot hands on hips looking down at a telephone after a motionless beat  He shuts the door and has already seen the shower curtain on the floor  The door swings open and Jerry edges in looking about holding a sack of groceries  he goes back to work on the windshield  Jerry goes into a frenzy banging the scraper against the windshield and the hood of his car but the tantrum passes scrapescrapescrape   the scrapescrapescrape sound carries in the frigid air  He goes to his car opens its front door pulls out a red plastic scraper and starts methodically scraping off the thin crust of ice that has developed on his windshield  Jerry emerges wrapped in a parka his arms sticking stiffly out at his sides his breath vaporizing  We are high and wide on the office building's parking lot  Wade scowls looks at Stan and is angry  another man rises as Jerry enters and Stan Grossman shakes his hand  Wade sits behind his desk  Grimsrud follows and trots down after her  Jean crashes against the upstairs railing trips on the curtain and falls thumping crazily down the stairs  still thrashing  Jean rushes toward the door cloaked by the shower curtain but awkwardly trying to push it off

test_cases.name: Jumble Segments Order
test_cases.description: Jerry stands in wide shot hands on hips looking down at a telephone after a motionless beat  The trooper walks up the shoulder one hand resting lightly on top of his holster his breath steaming in the cold night air  Wade scowls looks at Stan and is angry  Carl starts and looks back out the rear window fifty yards behind  We are high and wide on the office building's parking lot  Carl drives while Jean lies bound and curled on the back seat underneath a tarpaulin and from the back seat we hear whimpering  Jean rushes toward the door cloaked by the shower curtain but awkwardly trying to push it off  As we hear the rumble of an approaching car the continuing tilt and boom down brings us down the woodsman's body to a pedestal  he picks up the phone and punches in a number  another man rises as Jerry enters and Stan Grossman shakes his hand  Carl opens his window as the trooper draws up  Carl looks up at the rearview mirror and Grimsrud looks at him  Wade sits behind his desk  The headlights sweep off and a car hums past and on into the background  The twolane highway is otherwise empty  At a loud WHOOP  Both cars have stopped and Carl looks into the back seat as the car bounces and slows on the gravel shoulder  the trooper scans car interior taking his time while Grimsrud smokes and gazes calmly out his window He shuts the door and has already seen the shower curtain on the floor  still thrashing  Jerry emerges wrapped in a parka his arms sticking stiffly out at his sides his breath vaporizing  A sweep of headlights illuminates a sign on the pedestal  Grimsrud smokes and gazes out the window then turns to look and stares at  Jerry goes into a frenzy banging the scraper against the windshield and the hood of his car but the tantrum passes scrapescrapescrape   a state trooper has turned on his gumballs  he goes back to work on the windshield  Jean crashes against the upstairs railing trips on the curtain and falls thumping crazily down the stairs  Grimsrud follows and trots down after her  the scrapescrapescrape sound carries in the frigid air  Carl then turns back to the window  The trooper is stopped on the shoulder just behind them writing in his citation book as Carl watches and Grimsrud stares at Carl  The door swings open and Jerry edges in looking about holding a sack of groceries  He goes to his car opens its front door pulls out a red plastic scraper and starts methodically scraping off the thin crust of ice that has developed on his windshield  It is a flannelshirt woodsman carrying a doubleedged axe over one shoulder
